titleStmt.title: Adrian Van Sinderen to James W. Tate
CWG8036

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York State, New York

body.p:
ADRIAN VAN SINDEREN,
Attorney and Counsellor,
69 Wall Street.
New York, 3rd July 1863
Dear Sir --

My commission for Kentucky, dated 1st ulto, was duly recd and I should have qualiified before this time, had I not been necessarily out of town. Please find enclosed $5. and my official oath, with an impression of seal appended, though this may be unnecessary, as there is one already on file in your office.

I am, Sir,
Yours very truly.
Adrian VanSinderen

To
James W. Tate,
Asst. Secy. of State, of Ky.
